article.headline: Miami 80, Appalachian St. 63
article.story: CORAL GABLES, Fla. (AP) -- Robert Hite scored 18 points and Guillermo Diaz added 15 to help Miami beat Appalachian State 80-63 Thursday for its seventh consecutive win. Forward Gary Hamilton had a career-high 12 points and a game-high 12 rebounds in 21 minutes off the bench for Miami (8-2). Noah Brown scored 14 points for Appalachian State (5-5). Miami broke the game open with a 20-4 run to end the first half, holding Appalachian State scoreless for more than seven minutes. The Hurricanes scored the first six points of the second half to take a 48-24 lead, and the Mountaineers never got closer than 17 points off the lead after that. Miami's guard trio of Hite, Diaz and Anthony Harris combined for 42 points, 14 rebounds and 12 assists. The Hurricanes shot 48.5 percent from the field and scored 16 fast-break points. Appalachian State shot just 33.9 percent from the field, connecting on just 9 of 31 3-point field goals. Miami now has just a Jan. 2 game against Norfolk State before beginning play in the Atlantic Coast Conference. The Hurricanes' first ACC game will come at Georgia Tech on Jan. 6.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
